title.content-text: 6.1.2 Role of Protocols in Client/Server Communication

brief.content-text:
Two Diagrams

Diagram 1, Image
The diagram identifies some the protocols, which are used to ensure reliable information exchange when a host attempts to access Web Services. The diagram uses the same topology described in 6.1.1.1.
HTTP
Specifies the format of the web page request (from client) and response (from server).
TCP
Determines the flow control and acknowledgements of packet exchange.
IP
Identifies the source and destination as packets are sent across the network.
